company.name: IOActive, Inc.
company.business_description: IOActive, Inc. provides security consulting services, including data protection and privacy compliance services.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

complaint.factual_background: IOActive, Inc., a security consulting company, represented on its website that it was a current participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework from May 2009 until May 2015. However, the company failed to renew its Safe Harbor self-certification in May 2012, and Commerce updated its status to 'not current.' Despite this lapse, IOActive continued to display the Safe Harbor Certification Mark and make claims about its participation for approximately three years.

representations_made.description: Represented that it was a current participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework through privacy policy statements and display of the Safe Harbor Certification Mark on its website
representations_made.quoted_text: 12. Since at least May 2009 until May 2015, respondent disseminated or caused to be disseminated privacy policies and statements on its website, www.ioactive.com/privacy- policy.html, including but not limited to, the following privacy policy statement and display of the mark:

counts.title: Misrepresentations Regarding Safe Harbor Participation
counts.representation: Respondent represented, expressly or by implication, that it was a current participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework
counts.fact: Beginning in 2012, respondent was not a current participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework
counts.conclusion: Therefore, the representation set forth in Paragraph 13 is false and misleading.

definitions.respondent: IOActive, Inc. and its successors and assigns.
definitions.Commerce: as defined in Section 4 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 44.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Privacy or Security Program Participation
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent the extent to which it is a member of, adheres to, complies with, is certified by, is endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy or security program sponsored by the government or any self-regulatory or standard-setting organization.

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent participation in any privacy or security program, including the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS ORDERED that respondent and its officers, agents, representatives, and employees, whether acting directly or indirectly, in connection with the advertising, marketing, promotion, offering for sale, or sale of any product or service, in or affecting commerce, shall not misrepresent in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which respondent is a member of, adheres to, complies with, is certified by, is endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy or security program sponsored by the government or any self-regulatory or standard- setting organization, including, but not limited to, the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping Requirements
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the FTC for inspection all documents relating to compliance with the order for five years from the date of preparation or dissemination.

requirements.description: Maintain for 5 years all advertisements, promotional materials, and statements containing representations covered by this order, with supporting materials
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall maintain and upon request make available to the Federal Trade Commission for inspection and copying, a print or electronic copy of, for a period of five (5) years from the date of preparation or dissemination, whichever is later, all documents relating to compliance with this order, including but not limited to: A. all advertisements, promotional materials, and any other statements containing any representations covered by this order, with all materials relied upon in disseminating the representation; and

requirements.description: Maintain for 5 years any documents that call into question respondent's compliance with this order
requirements.quoted_text: B. any documents, whether prepared by or on behalf of respondent, that call into question respondent’s compliance with this order.

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment and Distribution
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this order to current and future personnel with responsibilities relating to the subject matter, and secure signed acknowledgments of receipt within 30 days of delivery.

requirements.description: Deliver order to all current principals, officers, directors, managers, employees, agents, and representatives with relevant responsibilities
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall deliver a copy of this order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, and managers, and to all current and future employees, agents, and representatives having responsibilities relating to the subject matter of this order. Respondent shall deliver this order to such current personnel within thirty (30) days

requirements.description: Deliver order to future personnel with relevant responsibilities
requirements.quoted_text: after service of this order, and to such future personnel within thirty (30) days after the person assumes such position or responsibilities. For any business entity resulting from any change in

requirements.description: For any business entity resulting from change in structure, deliver order prior to the change
requirements.quoted_text: assumes such position or responsibilities. For any business entity resulting from any change in structure set forth in Part IV, delivery shall be at least ten (10) days prior to the change in structure. Respondent must secure a signed and dated statement acknowledging receipt of this

requirements.description: Secure signed and dated acknowledgment statement from all persons receiving a copy of the order
requirements.quoted_text: structure. Respondent must secure a signed and dated statement acknowledging receipt of this order, within thirty (30) days of delivery, from all persons receiving a copy of the order pursuant to this section.

provisions.title: Notification of Corporate Changes
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the Commission at least 30 days prior to any corporate change that may affect compliance obligations, including dissolution, merger, sale, bankruptcy, or changes in corporate name or address.

requirements.description: Notify Commission at least 30 days prior to any corporate change affecting compliance obligations (dissolution, merger, sale, subsidiary creation/dissolution, bankruptcy filing, name/address change)
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall notify the Commission at least thirty (30) days prior to any change in the corporation(s) that may affect compliance obligations arising under this order, including, but not limited to: a dissolution, assignment, sale, merger, or other action that would result in the emergence of a successor corporation; the creation or dissolution of a subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this order; the proposed filing of a bankruptcy petition; or a change in the corporate name or address. Provided, however, that, with respect to any proposed change in the corporation(s) about which respondent learns fewer than thirty (30) days prior to the date such action is to take place, respondent shall notify the Commission as soon as is practicable after obtaining such knowledge.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a compliance report with the Commission within 90 days after service of this order and submit additional reports upon request within 10 days of written notice.

requirements.description: File initial compliance report setting forth in detail the manner and form of compliance with this order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent, and its successors and assigns, within ninety (90) days after the date of service of this order, shall file with the Commission a true and accurate report, in writing, setting forth in detail the manner and form of its compliance with this order. Within ten (10) days of receipt of written notice from a representative of the Commission,

requirements.description: Submit additional compliance report upon written notice from Commission representative
requirements.quoted_text: order. Within ten (10) days of receipt of written notice from a representative of the Commission, it shall submit an additional true and accurate written report.

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: This order will terminate on September 29, 2035, or 20 years from the most recent date that the United States or Commission files a complaint in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later.

requirements.description: Order terminates on September 29, 2035, or 20 years from most recent complaint filing date, whichever is later
requirements.quoted_text: This order will terminate on September 29, 2035, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying consent decree) in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A. any Part in this order that terminates in fewer than twenty (20) years; Page 3 of 4 B. this order’s application to any respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and C. this order if such complaint is filed after the order has terminated pursuant to this Part. Provided, further, that if such complaint is dismissed or a federal court rules that respondent did not violate any provision of the order, and the dismissal or ruling is either not appealed or upheld on appeal, then the order as to such respondent will terminate according to this Part as though the complaint had never been filed, except that the order will not terminate between the date such complaint is filed and the later of the deadline for appealing such dismissal or ruling and the date such dismissal or ruling is upheld on appeal.

duration.termination_text: This order will terminate on September 29, 2035, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying consent decree) in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later
